Tools

It is necessary to specify the paths to both AnyWave and HiBoP executable files in order to visualize time series and CCEPs with those softwares.

Time series visualization

It is possible to visualize the time series of both preprocessed iEEG files and cropped stimulations using AnyWave. Use the time series tool, after selecting preprocessing or cropping step(s) in the interactive table.

A popup will show relevant preprocessed iEEG files or cropped stimulations to display.

Quality control

AnyWave can also be used to mark or correct bad channels. Use the time series tool, after selecting cropping step(s) in the interactive table.

A popup will show all cropped stimulations.

Once a cropped stimulation is displayed in AnyWave, edit the montage as illustrated in the figure below. This will write a companion *.mat.bad file used by CCEP Manager during the validation process to update bad channels in all companion files accordingly.

CCEP visualization

It is possible to visualize CCEPs computed from cropped stimulations using HiBoP. Access the CCEP tool, after selecting cropping step(s) in the interactive table.

A HiBoP project will be created and will contain all the cropped stimulations, the electrode coordinates and imaging data (if any) will be imported as well. It will also include a basic HiBoP protocol and visualizations as illustrated in the figure below. Please refer to HiBoP documentation for more information. By default, the HiBoP project will be created in the /code directory of the active BIDS database.

Feature tables

The features tool can be used to store the various scores extracted from CCEP features into convenient text (*.txt) files. It will generate a text file for each feature and threshold when applicable ([Trebaul_2018]).

Output files can be found in the following directory:

BIDS root/derivatives/ccep_manager/step_averaging/sub-<id>/ses-<session>/ieeg/<iEEG file>/features_tables

And use the following naming convention:

<iEEG file>_<feature>_<threshold>.txt

  • <iEEG> is the name of the iEEG file.

  • <feature> is the name of the feature.

  • <threshold> is the threshold value.

In each text file, rows and columns correspond to stimulating and recording bipolar channels respectively.
